      • createPieChart

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createPieChart​(int radius,
                                               double[] percentValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color[] colors)
        Create a pie chart with the given values for the radius, the percentValues, the colors...
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the pie chart that is created.
        percentValues - The values for each part of the pie chart as percent values.
        colors - The colors for each part of the pie chart.
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a pie chart calculated by the given values.

      • createPieChart

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createPieChart​(int radius,
                                               double[] percentValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color[] colors,
                                               String[] legend)
        Create a pie chart with the given values for the radius, the percentValues, the colors...
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the pie chart that is created.
        percentValues - The values for each part of the pie chart as percent values.
        colors - The colors for each part of the pie chart.
        legend - The names of each field for the legend.
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a pie chart calculated by the given values.

      • createPieChart

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createPieChart​(int radius,
                                               double[] percentValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color[] colors,
                                               String[] legend,
                                               greenfoot.Color backgroundColor)
        Create a pie chart with the given values for the radius, the percentValues, the colors...
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the pie chart that is created.
        percentValues - The values for each part of the pie chart as percent values.
        colors - The colors for each part of the pie chart.
        legend - The names of each field for the legend.
        backgroundColor - The background color of the whole chart.
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a pie chart calculated by the given values.

      • createPieChart

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createPieChart​(int radius,
                                               double[] percentValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color[] colors,
                                               String[] legend,
                                               boolean displayValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color backgroundColor)
        Create a pie chart with the given values for the radius, the percentValues, the colors...
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the pie chart that is created.
        percentValues - The values for each part of the pie chart as percent values.
        colors - The colors for each part of the pie chart.
        legend - The names of each field for the legend.
        displayValues - You can choose whether the values should be displayed or not.
        backgroundColor - The background color of the whole chart.
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a pie chart calculated by the given values.

      • createPieChart

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createPieChart​(int radius,
                                               double[] percentValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color[] colors,
                                               String[] legend,
                                               boolean displayValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                                               greenfoot.Color textColor,
                                               greenfoot.Color frameColor,
                                               int frameWidth)
        Create a pie chart with the given values for the radius, the percentValues, the colors...
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the pie chart that is created.
        percentValues - The values for each part of the pie chart as percent values.
        colors - The colors for each part of the pie chart.
        legend - The names of each field for the chart.
        displayValues - You can choose whether the values should be displayed or not.
        backgroundColor - The background color of the whole chart.
        textColor - The text color of the legend.
        frameColor - The color of the frame (if there is one).
        frameWidth - The width of the frame (0 = no frame).
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a pie chart calculated by the given values.

      • move

        public double[] move​(double currentX,
                     double currentY,
                     double angle,
                     double distance)
        The position of an Actor that is moved the given distance into the given direction.
        Parameters:
        currentX - The current x coordinate of the actor.
        currentY - The current y coordinate of the actor.
        angle - The angle to which the actor should be moved.
        distance - The distance the actor should be moved.
        Returns:
        Returns the new coordinates of the actor as a double array.

      • createBarChart

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createBarChart​(double maxValue,
                                               double[] absoluteValues,
                                               greenfoot.Color[] colors,
                                               String[] legend,
                                               int width,
                                               int height)
        Creates a bar chart with the given values for the max height, absolute values, colors, ...
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The maximum value that the bar chart can reach.
        absoluteValues - The values for each bar of the bar chart as absolute values.
        colors - The colors for each bar of the bar chart.
        legend - The names of each bar for the chart.
        width - The width of the chart itselves. This value is not the width of the whole image.
        height - The height of the chart itselves. This value is not the height of the whole image.
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a bar chart calculated by the given values.

        width - The width of the chart itselves. This value is not the width of the whole image.
        height - The height of the chart itselves. This value is not the height of the whole image.

                                               int frameWidth)
        Creates a bar chart with the given values for the max height, absolute values, colors, ...
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The maximum value that the bar chart can reach.
        absoluteValues - The values for each bar of the bar chart as absolute values.
        colors - The colors for each bar of the bar chart.
        legend - The names of each bar for the chart.
        displayValues - You can choose whether the values should be displayed or not.
        width - The width of the chart itselves. This value is not the width of the whole image.
        height - The height of the chart itselves. This value is not the height of the whole image.
        backgroundColor - The background color of the whole chart.
        textColor - The text color of the legend.
        frameColor - The color of the frame (if there is one).
        frameWidth - The width of the frame (0 = no frame).
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a bar chart calculated by the given values.

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createSurfaceChart​(double maxValue,
                                                   Point[] absoluteValues,
                                                   int width,
                                                   int height,
                                                   greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                                                   greenfoot.Color surfaceColor)
        Creates a surface chart with the given values for the max height, absolute values, ...
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The maximum value that the point chart can reach.
        absoluteValues - The values for each point as absolute values.
        width - The width of the chart itselves. This value is not the width of the whole image.
        height - The height of the chart itselves. This value is not the height of the whole image.
        backgroundColor - The background color of the whole chart.
        surfaceColor - The color of the surface.
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a surface chart calculated by the given values.

      • createSurfaceChart

        public greenfoot.GreenfootImage createSurfaceChart​(double maxValue,
                                                   Point[] absoluteValues,
                                                   int width,
                                                   int height,
                                                   greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                                                   greenfoot.Color surfaceColor,
                                                   greenfoot.Color frameColor,
                                                   int frameWidth)
        Creates a surface chart with the given values for the max height, absolute values, ...
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The maximum value that the point chart can reach.
        absoluteValues - The values for each point as absolute values.
        width - The width of the chart itselves. This value is not the width of the whole image.
        height - The height of the chart itselves. This value is not the height of the whole image.
        backgroundColor - The background color of the whole chart.
        surfaceColor - The color of the surface.
        frameColor - The color of the frame (if there is one).
        frameWidth - The width of the frame (0 = no frame).
        Returns:
        Returns a GreenfootImage with a surface chart calculated by the given values.

      • round

        public double round​(double value,
                    int decimalPlaces)
        Round a double value to a variable number of decimal plases.
        Parameters:
        value - The double value that should be rounded.
        decimalPlaces - The number of decimal places you want to round the double value to.
        Returns:
        The double value roundet to the given number of decimal places.

      • calculateCrossingPointByAngle

        public double[] calculateCrossingPointByAngle​(Point p1,
                                              Point p2,
                                              double angle1,
                                              double angle2)
        Calculates the crossing point of two lines that are calculated by a point of each line and the angle of each line.
        Parameters:
        p1 - Any point of the first line.
        p2 - Any point of the second line.
        angle1 - The angle of the first line in degrees (0 => vertical line, 90 => horizontal line).
        angle2 - The angle of the second line in degrees (0 => vertical line, 90 => horizontal line).
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the crossing point of the two lines as a double array.

      • calculateCrossingPointBySlope

        public double[] calculateCrossingPointBySlope​(Point p1,
                                              Point p2,
                                              double slope1,
                                              double slope2)
        Calculates the crossing point of two lines that are calculated by a point of each line and the slope of each line.
        Parameters:
        p1 - Any point of the first line.
        p2 - Any point of the second line.
        angle1 - The slope of the first line.
        angle2 - The slope of the second line.
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the crossing point of the two lines as a double array.
